summary: an approved port of the Morrowind Swords for Oblivion. Adds swords that were in Morrowind to Skyrim!
descriptionHtml:
[URL=http://s1298.photobucket.com/user/BrokenCycle3434/media/44954-1-1394451012_zpsd6cc1f5b.png.html][IMG]http://i1298.photobucket.com/albums/ag55/BrokenCycle3434/44954-1-1394451012_zpsd6cc1f5b.png[/IMG][/URL]

"Elegant weapons, for a more Elegant Age"

Original mod for Oblivion here: http://www.nexusmods.com/oblivion/mods/44954/?

Requirements:
- Skyrim 1.9 no DLC needed

This mod includes;
- Temreki (two handed)
- Magebane (two handed)
- Fury (two handed)
- Sword of Agustas (two handed)
- Shadowsting (one-handed, shortsword)
- Shimsil (one-handed, shortsword)
- Clanbringer (one-handed)
- Dagger of Symmachus (dagger)

all placed in the world of Skyrim for you to find... if you explore and keep your eyes open, you will find them.

Backstory:

Orginally these weapons were in Morrowind, sold to a muesem by the Neverine before leaving for Akavir. The store owner had no sooner bought these weapons before being slaughtered by bandits who made off with the weapons.

A few years later these bandits had gone from footpads to Lords of their own bandit clans in neighboring Cyrodil. There they were one by one slain by the future Champion of Cyrodil.

After the CoC went missing, presumed dead...or insane. The swords were recovered by various people following the dawn of the Fourth Era. The Great War broke out and some of the swords were lost with there masters, while others found new masters or there old masters fled.

Now at the end of the world, these swords call out to be found. Can you find them and defeat their guardians and claim them for yourself?

Details:
- All weapons are daedric/dragonbone quality.
- All weapons swing faster (if only a notch in some) then their vanilla counterparts
- All weapons are upgradable at grinding wheels, but can not be forged
- All weapons are lighter then their vanilla counterparts
- All weapons have a unique model and texture
- All weapons are spread around the world, explore! there is no map or book or list with the locations ingame (if you want the locations and can't be patient, the list is at the bottom of the description)

Mod Notes & Changelog:
- version 0.1 is the first version
- version 0.2 will have the special effects for the weapons as scripts (ex. silverswordscript) so they will be free to customize with enchantments while retaining there "lore friendlness"


Credits:
- Bethesda for Skyrim
- Nifscope
- Gimp
- Billyro for his mod Morrowind Swords and allowing me to port them and for his Morrowind Swords img banner






SPOLIERS!!!!!! DO NOT LOOK AT THIS LIST UNLESS YOU WANT TO SPOIL IT FOR YOURSELF!




[spoiler] - Sword of Agustas: Whiterun Hall of the Dead, the "Forgotten Coffin"

- Shimsil: Broken Fang Cave, in the hands of vampire Remus the Nightblade - hostile

- Shadowsting: Kjenstag Ruins, wielded by Teeniva the Shadowscale -hostile/not hostile (if in DB)

- Temreki: Falkreath Hall of the Dead, in the "Old Coffin" under the table, hidden by the Arkay
Priest

- Clanbringer: Largashbur Cellar, under the bar

- Fury: Weynon Stones, wielded by the Deranged Disciple of Fury - hostile

- Magebane: Anise's Cabin in the cellar, on the enchanting table

- Dagger of Symmachus: Wreck of the Winter War, underwater at the crack, in the "Old Coffin" -hostile bandits [/spoiler]
author: Billyro and modder3434
